<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Barbarian Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6190) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=572" />
<trait label="Multiclass" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=659" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 176 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Barbarian](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=229)

**Prerequisites**
Constitution +2; Strength +2

</column>

---

You become trained in Athletics; if you were already trained in [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in barbarian class DC. You can use the Rage action. While raging, you take a –1 penalty to AC. Choose an instinct as you would if you were a barbarian. You have that instinct for all purposes, but you don’t gain any of the other abilities it grants. If that instinct has anathema, you’re bound by them. 

<document level="2" id="action-2802" />

<title level="2">Barbarian Dedication leads to...</title>
[Barbarian Resiliency](/Feats.aspx?ID=6191), [Basic Fury](/Feats.aspx?ID=6192), [Instinct Ability](/Feats.aspx?ID=6194), [Juggernaut's Fortitude](/Feats.aspx?ID=6195)
